seo.title: Chain Link Fence Installation Wilmington NC | Commercial & Residential
seo.description: Professional chain link fence installation in Wilmington NC. Galvanized & vinyl-coated options for homes, businesses & sports facilities. Free estimates!

hero.title: Chain Link Fences
hero.headline: Professional Chain Link Fence Installation in Wilmington
hero.description: When you need reliable security at an affordable price, chain link delivers. Flytrap Fence Company installs commercial and residential chain link fencing throughout the Wilmington area—from backyard dog runs to industrial perimeter security. Durable, cost-effective, and built to last decades with minimal maintenance.

benefits.title: Why Chain Link Fencing Makes Sense

items.title: Unbeatable Value
items.description: Chain link is the most economical fencing option per linear foot, making it ideal for enclosing large areas. Get maximum coverage within your budget—whether you're fencing a backyard, commercial lot, or multi-acre property.

items.title: Proven Durability
items.description: Galvanized steel chain link is built to last 20+ years with virtually no maintenance. It won't rot, warp, or deteriorate like wood, and it stands up to impacts that would damage other fence types.

items.title: Security Without Obstruction
items.description: The open-weave design provides clear sightlines for monitoring activity while still establishing a secure perimeter. Ideal for businesses, dog owners, and parents who want to see what's happening on both sides of the fence.

items.title: Quick Installation
items.description: Chain link installs faster than any other fencing type, which means lower labor costs and less disruption to your property. Most residential projects complete in a single day.

items.title: Low Maintenance
items.description: Once installed, chain link requires almost zero upkeep. No painting, staining, or treatments needed. Simply hose off dirt occasionally and enjoy decades of reliable service.

items.title: Versatile Applications
items.description: From residential backyards to sports facilities, construction sites to animal enclosures—chain link adapts to nearly any fencing need. Multiple heights, gauges, and coating options let you customize for your specific application.

styles.title: Chain Link Fence Options
styles.description: Today's chain link fencing offers more options than ever. We'll help you choose the right combination of height, gauge, coating, and accessories for your specific needs:

items.name: Galvanized Chain Link
items.description: The classic silver finish. Hot-dipped galvanized steel provides excellent corrosion resistance at the lowest cost. This workhorse option is perfect for backyards, commercial properties, and any application where function matters more than aesthetics.

items.name: Vinyl-Coated (Black)
items.description: Galvanized chain link with a black PVC coating for enhanced aesthetics and extra corrosion protection. Black virtually disappears into the background, making it ideal for properties where you want security without visual intrusion.

items.name: Vinyl-Coated (Green)
items.description: Blends naturally with landscaping and vegetation. Green vinyl-coated chain link is popular for backyards, parks, sports facilities, and anywhere you want the fence to complement rather than contrast with the surrounding environment.

items.name: Commercial/Heavy-Duty
items.description: Heavier gauge wire (9 or 6 gauge vs. standard 11.5), industrial-strength posts, and commercial hardware for maximum security and durability. Designed for high-traffic, high-security applications.

items.name: Privacy Slats
items.description: Transform standard chain link into a privacy fence by adding vertical slats. Available in various colors to match or complement your property. A cost-effective way to add privacy to existing or new chain link installations.

items.name: Temporary/Construction
items.description: Portable chain link panels for construction sites, events, and temporary enclosures. Quick to set up and remove. Available for purchase or rental depending on your needs.

steps.title: Site Visit & Assessment
steps.description: We survey your property, discuss your requirements (pet containment, security level, aesthetics), and take measurements. We'll identify the best post locations, gate placements, and any terrain challenges.

steps.title: Specification & Quote
steps.description: Based on your needs, we recommend the appropriate mesh gauge, height, coating, and hardware. You receive a detailed quote within 24-48 hours with no hidden costs or surprises.

steps.title: Utility Marking & Permits
steps.description: We coordinate with NC811 to mark underground utilities and obtain any required permits from your local municipality. Safety first, always.

steps.title: Post Installation
steps.description: Terminal posts (corners, ends, gates) and line posts are set in concrete at proper intervals and depths. For most residential applications, posts are set 24-30 inches deep for stability.

steps.title: Framework & Mesh Installation
steps.description: Top rails, tension bars, and bands are installed to create the framework. The chain link fabric is then stretched taut along the fence line and secured with ties.

steps.title: Gates & Finishing
steps.description: Gates are hung, adjusted for smooth operation, and equipped with appropriate latches. We complete a final inspection, clean up all debris, and walk through the project with you.

items.question: How long does chain link fencing last?
items.answer: With galvanized coating, chain link fencing typically lasts 20-25 years in Wilmington's coastal climate. Vinyl-coated chain link can last even longer—30+ years—due to the additional layer of corrosion protection. With minimal maintenance, your chain link fence will provide decades of reliable service.

items.question: What gauge wire should I choose?
items.answer: For residential applications, 11.5 gauge wire is standard and sufficient for most needs. If you have large dogs, need extra security, or want maximum durability, we recommend 9 gauge. Commercial and industrial applications often use 6 gauge for heavy-duty security. We'll recommend the appropriate gauge during your consultation.

items.question: Can you add privacy to chain link fencing?
items.answer: Absolutely. Privacy slats insert vertically into the chain link mesh, providing 70-90% privacy coverage depending on the style. Slats are available in various colors including green, tan, brown, black, and white. They also reduce wind and can extend the life of your fence by reducing stress on the mesh.

items.question: Is chain link fencing good for dogs?
items.answer: Chain link is one of the best choices for dog containment. The tight mesh prevents dogs from squeezing through, and the visibility lets you monitor your pet while they're outside. For diggers, we can install bottom tension wire or bury the mesh slightly below grade. For jumpers, we install heights up to 8 feet or add deterrent extensions.

items.question: Does chain link work for pool enclosures?
items.answer: Yes, with the proper specifications. We install chain link pool fencing that meets North Carolina pool barrier codes, including minimum 4-foot height, self-closing/self-latching gates, and proper mesh size to prevent climbing. Black vinyl-coated chain link is a popular, budget-friendly pool fence option.

items.question: How quickly can chain link be installed?
items.answer: Chain link installs faster than any other fence type. Most residential projects (100-300 linear feet) complete in a single day. Larger commercial installations may take 2-3 days. This quick installation means lower labor costs and less disruption to your property.

items.question: What maintenance does chain link require?
items.answer: Very little. Chain link is essentially maintenance-free. Occasionally rinse off dirt and debris with a hose. Check gate hardware periodically and lubricate hinges once a year. That's it. No painting, staining, or treatments required—ever.

items.question: Can chain link be installed on uneven ground?
items.answer: Yes. Chain link actually handles slopes and uneven terrain better than rigid panel fencing. The flexible mesh can follow the contour of your land while still maintaining a secure enclosure. We'll assess your terrain and recommend the best approach during the site visit.

pricing.title: Chain Link Fence Pricing in Wilmington
pricing.description: Chain link offers the best value per linear foot of any fencing option. Standard galvanized residential fencing starts around $15/linear foot, while vinyl-coated and heavy-gauge commercial installations range from $25-$35/linear foot. Gate costs vary by size and type. We provide transparent, itemized quotes so you know exactly what you're getting.
includes: Galvanized or vinyl-coated chain link fabric
Galvanized steel posts and top rails
All tension bars, bands, and hardware

cta.headline: Affordable Security for Any Property
cta.description: Get a free quote for chain link fence installation in Wilmington, Leland, Hampstead, or anywhere in the Cape Fear region. From backyard dog runs to commercial perimeters, we deliver quality installation at competitive prices.
